item.title: dotNetDave Rocks Austin .NET User Group November 2025 Meeting
item.description: The dotNetDave No Rest for the Wicked World Tour will visit Austin on November 20, 2025, where I will present a session titled "Röck Yoür Cöde." This session addresses critical issues in memory management related to disposable types in .NET, offering practical techniques to enhance application performance and prevent slowdowns and leaks. item.title: Defensive Programming Rule #3: Validate Your Enums (Every Time)
item.description: Enums enhance code readability but can lead to errors if not validated, as any integer can be cast as an Enum, including invalid values. Validating Enum inputs prevents silent data corruption, ensures meaningful defaults, and avoids processing impossible states. Always validate at method boundaries and define a zero value as "unknown." Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/11/09/defensive-programming-rule-3-validate-your-enums-every-time/
